scenarios.title: School Days

listening.receptive: Follow the main plot of simple stories told with visual support.
listening.interactive: Respond in a predictable pattern to simple questions about familiar things.

reading.reading2: Follow written instructions with visual aids.
reading.phonemic_awareness: Recognize all the letters of the alphabet in isolation and the correspondence between letter and sound at the beginning of words.

speaking.productive: Identify independently common actions seen in daily routines.
speaking.interactive: Participate in simple formulaic question-and-answer exchanges on familiar subjects.

writing.productive: Write simple thank-you notes or greetings in cards using one-sentence picture cards.
writing.interactive: Contribute, with help, a word to a class story or sentence.

mediation.text: Summarize short stories using drawings or pictures.
mediation.communication: Explain simple written instructions to peers using English or Spanish.

grammar: Past simple with the verb 'be' (e.g., 'Yesterday was...')

pragmatic: Answering questions about days: 'Yesterday was Wednesday.'
Expressing preferences: 'I like Friday. Art is on Friday!'
Discourse marker: and (e.g., 'Yesterday was Wednesday and I went outside!')
sociolinguistic: Talking about schedules: Communicating about daily classroom activities using appropriate language and turn-taking.

assessment_ideas: Observe student responses during daily schedule routines.
Check Time Travel Calendar drawings with labels like 'yesterday' or 'today'.
Review Weekly Story Journal entries for correct use of time markers and verbs.

scenarios.title: School Life Adventures

listening.receptive: Follow the main plot of simple stories told with visual support.
listening.interactive: Demonstrate comprehension of a variety of classroom commands.

reading.reading1: Identify key words and phrases in texts.
reading.reading2: Follow written instructions with visual aids.
reading.phonemic_awareness: Identify a spoken word's initial and final phoneme if these words have been previously encountered and are attached to a picture.

speaking.productive: Contribute to storytelling sessions with simple sentences based on visual prompts.
speaking.interactive: Use greetings and farewells appropriately in conversations with peers.

writing.productive: Write simple thank-you notes or greetings in cards using one-sentence picture cards.
writing.interactive: Contribute, with help, a word to a class story or sentence.

mediation.text: Use visual information in texts to convey meaning.
mediation.communication: Relay simple information received verbally using English or Spanish.

pragmatic: Describing objects with detail: 'This is a small bag.' 'That's a big, blue book.'
Responding to questions: 'What color is the book?' → 'It’s blue.'
sociolinguistic: Employing polite expressions: 'Can you please pass me the blue pencil?' or 'Thank you for the book.'

assessment_ideas: Observe participation in Classroom Object Bingo.
Review My Classroom Object Hunt posters with descriptive labels.
Assess use of adjectives and polite language during object-describing tasks.

scenarios.title: All About the Weather

listening.receptive: Comprehend simple descriptions of people, places, and things around them.
listening.interactive: Participate in call-and-response activities, responding appropriately to cues in songs or stories.

reading.reading1: Identify simple story elements (e.g., characters, setting).
reading.reading2: Find specific information in a text (e.g., names, quantities, dates).
reading.phonemic_awareness: Identify a spoken word's initial and final phoneme if these words have been previously encountered and are attached to a picture.

speaking.productive: Count up to 50 out loud with help.
speaking.interactive: Describe simple pictures or objects during classroom discussions.

writing.productive: Fill in blanks in sentences using a word bank related to a familiar context.
writing.interactive: Write simple words supported with drawings to peers.

mediation.text: Use visual information in texts to convey meaning.
mediation.communication: Describe everyday objects using visual support.

pragmatic: Describing the weather and activities: 'It's a sunny day, and I play outside.'
Responding to questions: 'What's the weather like?' → 'It's rainy. I need my umbrella.'
sociolinguistic: Expressing preferences: Talking about preferences related to weather and clothing.

assessment_ideas: Observe participation in weather chants and call-and-response songs.
Review Weather Journal entries for weather vocabulary and personal preferences.
Assess use of adjectives and WH-questions during Weather Forecast Videos.

scenarios.title: All About My Body

listening.receptive: Follow two-step spoken instructions related to classroom activities.
listening.interactive: Respond in a predictable pattern to simple questions about familiar things.

reading.reading1: Identify keywords and phrases in texts.
reading.reading2: Identify simple story elements (e.g., characters, setting).
reading.phonemic_awareness: Identify a spoken word's initial and final phoneme if these words have been previously encountered and are attached to a picture.

speaking.productive: Locate people, objects, and things around them.
speaking.interactive: Respond to simple verbal commands in classroom settings.

writing.interactive: Write simple words supported with drawings to peers.

mediation.text: Interpret simple phrases from a text.
mediation.communication: Describe everyday objects using visual support.

scenarios.title: Exploring My Community

listening.receptive: Comprehend simple descriptions of people, places, and things around them.
listening.interactive: Answer simple questions about a story they have just listened to.

reading.reading1: Identify keywords and phrases in texts.
reading.reading2: Identify simple story elements (e.g., characters, setting).
reading.phonemic_awareness: Identify a spoken word's initial and final phoneme if these words have been previously encountered and are attached to a picture.

speaking.productive: Introduce themselves or family members using basic personal information.
speaking.interactive: Take part in role-plays that mimic familiar everyday interactions.

writing.productive: Write simple phrases or sentences about personal experiences and familiar items with support and guidance.
writing.interactive: Contribute, with help, a word to a class story or sentence.

mediation.text: Connect ideas from a text with personal experiences.
mediation.concept: Show a connection between class concepts and personal experiences.

pragmatic: Describing places and activities: 'The park is big. I play there.'
Answering questions: 'Where is the library?' → 'Next to the market.'
sociolinguistic: Polite expressions to ask for location: 'Excuse me, where is the library?'

assessment_ideas: Observe role-play interactions about community places.
Review Community Map posters with labeled locations.
Assess ability to connect personal experiences to story content (e.g., 'I go to the market on weekends').

scenarios.title: Fun Outdoors!

listening.receptive: Follow two-step spoken instructions related to classroom activities.
listening.interactive: Retell a simple instruction or message accurately to another peer.

reading.reading2: Create a title or caption for a paragraph or image.
reading.phonemic_awareness: Identify a spoken word's initial and final phoneme if these words have been previously encountered and are attached to a picture.

speaking.productive: Express basic needs and feelings using simple phrases.
speaking.interactive: Interact in a predictable pattern with simple questions and answers about familiar things using simple phrases.

grammar: Subject + verb + adverb (e.g., 'I run fast.' 'I swim slowly.')
WH-questions (e.g., 'Why do you like to swim?')

Asking questions about others' preferences: 'Do you like to play outside?'

assessment_ideas: Observe expressions of preference during outdoor sports discussions.
Review Outdoor Sports Journal entries for action verbs and adverbs.

scenarios.title: It's Festival Season.
themes: Food I Eat During a Celebration

listening.receptive: Identify numbers and quantities when heard slowly and clearly.
listening.interactive: Follow directions in a game as instructed.

reading.reading1: Create a title or caption for a paragraph or image.
reading.phonemic_awareness: Recognize all the letters of the alphabet in isolation and the correspondence between letter and sound at the beginning of words.

speaking.productive: Express basic needs and feelings using simple phrases.
speaking.interactive: Interact in a predictable pattern with simple questions and answers about familiar things using simple phrases.

writing.interactive: Write simple messages to peers using words, drawings, and short phrases.

pragmatic: Describing favorite festival parts: 'I like the fireworks. They are bright.'

sociolinguistic: Cultural awareness: Talking about and showing respect for different festivals.

assessment_ideas: Observe participation in festival-themed polls and games.
Review Festival Celebration Posters for accurate use of descriptive language.
Assess ability to describe festival foods and activities using gestures and simple phrases.
